items.title: Should we archive this repository?
items.body:
Obviously we haven't had much activity here for quite some time, though I think there's some relevant context change since we were last working on this.

Not too long after we'd started initial work on this repo, Microsoft began providing their own official Docker images that largely covered all our original use cases. They also subsequently added features to the product (then VSTS now AzDO) to make it easy to dynamically install/use specific versions of tools from a pipeline via the tool installer framework and tasks.

Those changes, plus the subsequent availability of Azure Pipelines for free for open source projects largely obviated our need for self-hosting agents of any kind.

However... :smile: 
Microsoft subsequently stopped distributing their own ~2 years ago and these days simply provide documentation so as to assist those needing to self-host with Docker can build their own image.

https://github.com/microsoft/vsts-agent-docker
https://hub.docker.com/_/microsoft-azure-pipelines-vsts-agent

As such, if we _were_ to need custom Agent images, then we would have to roll our own and this repo seems like the place we'd want to do it. The question/challenge to that though is whether that's a real use case for us, current and/or a non-far fetched future possibility.

Given the current state of affairs, my sense is that this is a pretty unlikely hypothetical, and I am accordingly inclined to archive this repo (suppose we could always unarchive should the need arise)
